official-title.#text: To amend the National Trails System Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study on the feasibility of designating the Chief Standing Bear National Historic Trail, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

action-desc.#text: Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
Committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed

header.#text: Chief Standing Bear national historic trail feasibility study

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 5(c) of the National Trails System Act

quote.#text: Chief Standing Bear Removal and Return

text.#text: The Chief Standing Bear Trail, extending approximately 550 miles from Niobrara, Nebraska, to Ponca City, Oklahoma, which follows the route taken by Chief Standing Bear and the Ponca people during Federal Indian removal, and approximately 550 miles from Ponca City, Oklahoma, through Omaha, Nebraska, to Niobrara, Nebraska, which follows the return route taken by Chief Standing Bear and the Ponca people, as generally depicted on the map entitled
The map described in subparagraph (A) shall be on file and available for public inspection in the appropriate offices of the

The feasibility study conducted pursuant to subparagraph (A) shall include a determination on whether the Chief Standing Bear Trail meets the criteria in subsection (b) of for designation as a national historic trail.

header.#text: Chief Standing Bear national historic trail

text.#text: The feasibility study authorized by the amendment in subsection (a) shall be completed not later than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5086 RH: To amend the National Trails System Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study on the feasibility of designating the Chief Standing Bear National Historic Trail, and for other purposes.
